1.t: By the angels who violently tear-out the souls of the disbelievers from their bodies,

2.t: by the angels who gently release the souls of the believers,

3.t: by the angels who float (in the heavens by the will of God),

4.t: by the angels who hasten along

5.t: and by the angels who regulate the affairs, (you will certainly be resurrected).

6.t: On the day when the first trumpet sound blasts

7.t: and will be followed by the second one,

9.t: and eyes will be humbly cast down.

10.t: (The disbelievers) say, "Shall we be brought back to life again

11.t: after we have become bones and dust?"

12.t: They have said, "Such a resurrection will certainly be a great loss".

13.t: However, it will only take a single blast

14.t: to bring them out of their graves and back to life on the earth's surface.

15.t: (Muhammad), have you heard the story of Moses

16.t: when his Lord called him in the holy valley of Tuwa,
16.tr: Iz nadaahu rabbuhu bil-waadil muqad-dasi tuwa

17.t: saying, "Go to the Pharaoh. He has transgressed beyond all bounds.

18.t: And say to him, "Would you like to reform yourself?
18.tr: Faqul hal laka ilaa an tazakka

19.t: I shall guide you to your Lord so that you may perhaps have fear of Him".

20.t: Moses showed him the great miracle

21.t: but the Pharaoh rejected it and disobeyed (Moses).

22.t: Then he turned away in a hurry,

25.t: So God struck him with the torment of this life and the life hereafter.

26.t: In this there is a lesson for those who have fear of God.
26.tr: Inna fee zaalika la'ibratal limaiy yaksha

27.t: (People), is your creation harder for God than that of the heavens, which He created, raised and established
27.tr: A-antum a-shaddu khalqan amis samaa-u banaaha

29.t: He has made its nights dark and its days bright.

30.t: After this, He spread out the earth,

33.t: All this was done as a means of enjoyment for you and your cattle.

34.t: On the day when the great calamity comes,

35.t: the human being will recall whatever he has done.

36.t: Hell fire will become visible for those who would see it.

40.t: However, those who had feared their Lord and restrained their souls from acting according to its desires.
40.tr: Wa-ammaa man khaafa maqaama Rabbihee Wa-nahan nafsa 'anil hawaa

42.t: (Muhammad), they ask you, "When will the Hour of Doom come?"

43.t: (Muhammad), you do not know (when and how) it will come.

44.t: This matter is in the hands of your Lord.

45.t: You are only a warner for those who fear such a day.

46.t: On the day when they see it, it will seem to them as though they had only lived in the world for a morning and an afternoon.
46.tr: Ka-annahum Yawma yarawnahaa lam yalbasooo illaa 'ashiyyatan aw duhaahaa
